message.content:
**Analysis of the Main Target Image**

1. **Overall Count and Layering**

   - **Left (Red‐and‐Yellow) “Arch” Structure**  
     • **Four** red arch‐shaped blocks stacked in two layers (two arches on the bottom layer, two arches on the layer above).  
     • **Two** yellow “plank” blocks running left‐to‐right—one plank sits between the bottom and top arches, and the other is set across the very top of the upper arches.  

   - **Right (Green‐Orange‐Yellow) “Column” Structure**  
     • **Two** vertical green pillars on the bottom layer.  
     • **One** yellow plank bridging these two pillars in the next layer up.  
     • **One** orange cylinder (standing vertically) on top of that yellow plank.  
     • **One** yellow half‐cylinder (or “semi‐cylindrical cap”) perched on top of the orange cylinder.  

   In total there are **11** blocks:
   - 4 red arches  
   - 2 green pillars  
   - 3 yellow planks  
   - 1 orange cylinder  
   - 1 yellow half‐cylinder  

2. **Spatial Relationships**

   - **Left Side:**  
     • Bottom layer: 2 red arches (#1) side by side.  
     • Above them: 1 yellow plank (#8) spanning left‐to‐right, with the next 2 red arches (#1) resting on that plank.  
     • Across the tops of the upper red arches: another yellow plank (#8).  

   - **Right Side:**  
     • Bottom layer: 2 green pillars (#6) standing vertically.  
     • Above them: 1 yellow plank (#8) spanning the pillars from left to right.  
     • On top of that plank: 1 orange cylinder (#10) standing vertically.  
     • At the very top: 1 yellow half‐cylinder (#13), oriented so its curved face is visible from the front.  

---

**Selecting Blocks from the Dictionary**

From the second (dictionary) image, the required blocks (in the exact orientations shown, without rotation) are:

- **Red arch block – index  1**  
  (Needs 4 copies for the four red arches.)
- **Green rectangular pillar (vertical) – index  6**  
  (Needs 2 copies for the two green columns.)
- **Yellow plank (horizontal) – index  8**  
  (Needs 3 copies total: 2 for the left structure’s “planks” and 1 for the right structure’s bridging plank.)
- **Orange cylinder (vertical) – index  10**  
  (Needs 1 copy.)
- **Yellow half‐cylinder (front‐to‐back axis) – index  13**  
  (Needs 1 copy for the top “cap”.)

Hence the **block‐index list** (showing multiples where needed):

• #1 × 4  
• #6 × 2  
• #8 × 3  
• #10 × 1  
• #13 × 1  

---

**Step‐by‐Step Assembly Instructions**

Use the following format:

{
 Step1: Move block with index 1
 Step2: Move block with index 1
 ...
}

A possible build order is:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 1    (first red arch, left bottom)  
  Step2:  Move block with index 1    (second red arch, right bottom)  
  Step3:  Move block with index 8    (yellow plank bridging the two bottom arches)  
  Step4:  Move block with index 1    (third red arch, left top)  
  Step5:  Move block with index 1    (fourth red arch, right top)  
  Step6:  Move block with index 8    (yellow plank across the top arches)  

  Step7:  Move block with index 6    (first green pillar, right structure)  
  Step8:  Move block with index 6    (second green pillar)  
  Step9:  Move block with index 8    (yellow plank bridging the two green pillars)  
  Step10: Move block with index 10   (orange cylinder on top of the yellow plank)  
  Step11: Move block with index 13   (yellow half‐cylinder cap on the very top)
}
